Certainly! Here are some tips on how to present your requests for additional benefits during a negotiation:

1. Be confident: Believe in yourself and your value to the company. If you believe that you are worth the additional benefits or perks that you are requesting, it will be easier for the employer to see your worth.

2. Research: Do your research on what other companies offer in terms of benefits and perks, and present this information to the employer. This shows that you understand the industry standards and can help you make a stronger case.

3. Show the benefits to the company: Highlight how the additional benefits can benefit the company, such as how improving your skills can increase your productivity, and how more vacation time can help you recharge, and come back more refreshed and productive.

4. Be flexible: Be willing to negotiate on the type and amount of benefits you're asking for.  You can always revise your request if the employer is willing to negotiate.

5. Practice: Practice your negotiation skills and responses to possible objections. Practice with a friend or colleague to feel more comfortable and confident during the negotiation.

Overall, be respectful, professional, and friendly during the whole negotiation process. Show appreciation for the employer's time and their consideration by thanking them for their efforts even if they don't agree to all of your asks.
